subject: Social Science
title: Understanding Climate Zones
description: Explore the different climate zones around the world

content.text: Earth has different climate zones based on temperature, precipitation, and location. Understanding these zones helps us understand how people live in different parts of the world.

content.heading: Major Climate Zones
content.text: There are five major climate zones: Tropical, Dry, Temperate, Continental, and Polar.

content.heading: Tropical Climate
content.text: Found near the equator, tropical climates are hot and humid year-round with significant rainfall. Examples: Amazon Rainforest, Congo Basin.

content.heading: Polar Climate
content.text: Located near the poles, these regions are extremely cold with little precipitation. Examples: Antarctica, Arctic regions.

content.heading: Climate and Human Activity
content.problem: How does climate affect where people live?
solution: Tropical zones: People build houses elevated to deal with humidity and rainfall
Polar zones: Few permanent settlements due to extreme cold
Temperate zones: Most densely populated due to moderate climate
Desert zones: Settlements near water sources, architecture designed for heat

content.heading: Think About It
problems: Which climate zone do you live in?
How has your local climate influenced the architecture in your area?
What crops can be grown in tropical vs temperate climates?
